decision_conditions: The proposal falls outside the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 1, Classes B of the Town and Country Planning due to the following reasons;
The existing plans are inaccurate as they do not show the existing condition   of the property at either the date of submission of the application or at the date of the decision.
The concurrent Construction of a hip to gable roof and rear dormer extension along with the side and rear extensions could not lawfully be implemented.

It appears that the side/rear projecting extension has been constructed larger than what is shown on the existing and proposed plans. A wider rear extension would not only not comply with the planning permission associated with the proposed development but would also mean that the volume calculations provided by the applicant would be inaccurate.
description: Alteration of roof from hip to gable end; rear roof extension incorporating Juliet balcony: and installation of three rooflights to front roofslope (Lawful Development Certificate for a Proposed Development)
